purpose: Add defect-supported diagonal potentials V and sweep mu to test for bound/defect-localized modes; compute thresholds where defect mass exceeds 0.6; build coarse (lambda,mu) phase diagram candidates using the commuting structure with the V4 sector coin.

potentials.V_defect7: Diagonal potential on the 7 nodes incident to delta4 edges.
potentials.V_O6_4: Diagonal potential on O6-family defect nodes (4 nodes).
potentials.V_O12_4: Diagonal potential on O12-family defect nodes (4 nodes).
potentials.V_O6_minus_O12: Diagonal potential with +1 on O6 nodes and -1 on O12 nodes.

key_findings: Defect-localized bound-state behavior appears first and most strongly in m=3 (the spin/center-sensitive sector). For V_defect7, defect mass >0.6 occurs already at mu≈0.475 in m=3, while other m require larger mu (~1.7).
Family-specific potentials isolate families: V_O12_4 yields strong localization in m=3 starting around mu≈0.725; V_O6_4 yields strong localization in m=3 around mu≈0.725 and in m=2,4 around mu≈0.95.
The sign-split V_O6_minus_O12 exhibits asymmetry: strong localization can occur at negative mu for m=3, suggesting a natural 'charge' polarity between O6 and O12 families.
